fields.summary: Disabling warning notifications temporary

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41141].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
Log work to an issue is still possible even if the issue version is "Version Unrelease" or "Archive Version"

h3. Feature Request
Log work to an issue should be restricted if the issue version is "Version Unrelease" or "Archive Version"
fields.summary: Log work to an issue should be restricted if the issue version is "Version Unrelease" or "Archive Version"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41139].
  {panel}

The new Browse Projects view (Projects > View all projects > (All Projects in sidebar)) introduced in 6.4-OD-11 takes away the ability to list all of your projects grouped by category. I understand why this needed to be done but it's definitely a loss (see original issue for discussion on that). 

I could use the new Browse Projects view if the *table columns were sortable*. Then I'd just click the project category column to sort it and have something close to what I had before. Even better (but not critical) would be to have a "printable" view of this page that listed all projects using the current column sorting. 

So I'm making this enhancement request. 

Use case is that I produce a weekly report for management listing current projects, grouped by category. I used the previous view to produce this but I can't easily produce it using the new view or any other workaround suggested by Support or Product Management.
fields.summary: Browse Projects enhancement - sortable table columns, printable view
Add "Share" operation to individual gadgets, similar to Share button on the issue navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41137].
  {panel}

When linking JIRA to 2 different Stash instances, the applinks page shows these 2 Stash instances with different Names e.g. Stash1, Stash2. Type is of course the same Stash.

When creating a branch from Development panel, JIRA will ask to select which application to create a branch in. Here it will show Type only. Users can differentiate the apps by their URLs, but this may sometimes be inconvenient:
!branch.png|thumbnail!

Suggestion is to display Application Name together with Type in this popup window.
fields.summary: Display Name together with Type when linking JIRA to multiple applications of the same type

fields.description:
h4.Summary: 
If a two dimensional filter finds _irrelevant_ issues, the clickable totals button is removed, leaving a customer unable to click on the total to view the issues.

h4.Steps to Reproduce:
# Create 2 projects.
# Create a few issues in each project.
# Choose a field (I selected affected version/s) and disable it on the field screen in one of the projects.
# Add the two dimensional filter gadget to the dashboard.
# Select the field you choose on step 3 for your X and select your Y (i chose Status).
# Don't forget to set _Show Totals_ to _YES_ in your gadget :)


h4.Expected Results:
I would expect to be able to click on the total number at the end of my two dimensional filter.

h4.Actual Results:
The total number is black instead of clickable. If there are no _irrelevant_ issues the number is clickable.

h4.Notes:
See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter - Totals not clickable if irrelevant issues are found.
Implement a Hide Transition workflow condition

fields.description:
We get the wrong sender in mail notification which has been sent out if there is notification is configured for any action. It is quite confusing to see that the sender is different than the one who actually triggered/commented/acted on issue.

When a change is done on a case in jira, an email is sent and the sender is not correct.
For instance - if Jenni has made a change, it seems like Ariff has the "on behalf" sender from Jira, probably because he was the person who did most recent changes in another case than the one the email notification is about.
This is rather confusing and should be fixed.
"on Behalf"-senders should be the one who made the change, not a random Jira-user.
fields.summary: Wrong sender in notification mails
Ability to Modify createdDate
Linked issue field cannot link to external JIRA instances

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41116].
  {panel}

h3.Symptoms
When the user log work on the issue, an notification will be sent out as issue updated.
!issue_update.PNG|thumbnail!
Even in the notification schemed is configure to have no notifications sent for all the work log event.
!notification_scheme.PNG|thumbnail!

This is replicable in the latest OnDemand release 6.4-OD-11-012

h3. Workaround
Disable the issue updated notification will prevent the notification sent for work logging event but of course no notifications will not be sent when issue updated as well.
fields.summary: Work Log Notification is Sent as Issue Updated

fields.description:
If I write a JQL for searching in which I state that "component != XXX", the search results also ignores issues that do not have a component set.

For example, I have three issues, with one issue having component A, the second component B and the third one with component field empty.

If I write a query as "component != A", I would expect the last two issues to show up in the search results, but it only shows one result, the one with component set to B.
fields.summary: JQL search ignores issues that have empty fields
Automatic email address link doesn't support IDN
Header is displaced on IE11

fields.description:
JIRA Version: v6.3.4
Browsers tested: Chrome v39.0.2171.71 and Firefox v30.0

Data required: Search query should have more than 20 pages of results.

Steps to Reproduce:
1) Log into JIRA
2) Click Issues, then click Search for Issues
3) Enter string of "Status != Closed" (Ensure >20 pages of results appear)
4) Navigate through the pages, or adjust the URL to bring you to this page (/?jql=Status !%3D Closed&startIndex=950)

Expected: User should see hyperlinks for pages 21 and 22 on the bottom of the search results, and be able to continue navigation

Actual: User can click the hyperlinks, but nothing happens. Also, if the URL is adjusted to "&startIndex=950", the page will refresh, but only bring them to results 951-1000
fields.summary: JIRA > Issues > Search for Issues > Cannot navigate past page 20 of results
When logging work, users are getting notifications when logged work is off
Issue Statistics widget calculates percentages incorrectly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41107].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently we get a generic error when the user is not able to access JIRA.
"jirauser tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found."

h3. Suggested Solution
These are pretty distinctive reasons for the failed attempt and would be much more helpful if they had two separate error messages, one for the permission error ("do not have USE permission") and another for the LDAP search ("weren't found").
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like a more detailed error message for failed login attempts
Create a report that shows what the Task Board looked like on any given day

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce

# Generate a simple csv file with an issue (such as the one attached to this case) with a date value.
# During the import wizard, in the date format configuration, specify the date format that is being used on your CSV's date field

h3. Current behaviour

JIRA throws an error (sometimes it throws a warning, but we couldn't see a pattern) saying that the date format specified is not correct.

h3. Expected behaviour

Use the date configuration you've specified during the wizard and import the file properly.
fields.summary: CSV importer ignores date format specification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41104].
  {panel}

This request is from my question posted to Atlassian Answers:

Is it possible to move a dashboard from one instance to another?

Chris Volker about 17 hours ago
I have a user who has set-up extensive dashboards in one JIRA instance, and would like to move them to another.  I use Configuration Manager to make the snapshots and the deployment to the other instance.  So, the user should get his project and all associated elements, but not the dashboard(s) or his filters.  Can I move the dashboard independently for the user through other means?

Teilor Soares [Atlassian]about 6 hours ago
Hi Chris!
At this moment is not possible to export or import a dashboard. The only way to export a dashboard would be export the entire instance.
-Teilor
 CommentAccept answer
Peter Benabout 6 hours ago
Telior, do we have a JIRA ticket for this feature? Thanks
Teilor Soares [Atlassian]about 4 hours ago
No, we do not. You can create a new feature request in jira.atlassian.com. 

============================================
Thank you for considering this feature suggestion.

Chris
fields.summary: Ability to move a Dashboard(s) from one Jira Instance to another

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41101].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
Once you check turn on self sign up and save the settings, the checkbox will not be visible to verify that the feature is enabled. To disable it, you just need to click Save button. 

h3. Feature Request
Once you check turn on self sign up and save it, the checkbox should be visible to verify that the feature is enabled. To disable it, uncheck the check box and save button.
fields.summary: Check box for Turn on self signup should be visible after enabling the feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41100].
  {panel}

When you click search button in issue search, browser sends 2 or 3 request to this url: /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable/stable

It is causing following problems:
- flakiness of webdriver tests
- unnecessary issue re-render
- unnecessary request itself

Use this for more details: 
{code}JIRA.trace.callback = console.log.bind(console);{code}

!doublerequest.png!
fields.summary: Double request to /rest/issueNav/1/issueTable/stable on issue search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41098].
  {panel}

The UI updates introduced in 6.4-OD-11 have introduced a regression of functionality. Previously when viewing all projects (Projects > View all projects > (All Projects in sidebar)) they would be grouped by category, with a heading for each, all on one page. Now they're all listed together alphabetically across multiple pages. There is now no way to list all projects on one page, grouped by category. 

I relied on this view and consider its removal a regression.

I produce a weekly report for management listing current projects, grouped by category. I used the previous view to produce this but I can't easily produce it using the new view. Support tells me there's no workaround or alternate method to generate this.

Going forward, if there was an option to sort the category column and a way to view all projects on one page, this new view would work for me.
fields.summary: Regression: unable to list all projects grouped by category

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41097].
  {panel}

The same problem in [JRA-7925] still happens.

h3. Summary
In JIRA 3.3.2 Lead developer was changed to Project lead. However it was never changed in the workflows. 

!confusion.png|thumbnail!


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click post function on a workflow
# You will see the option for assign to lead developer which was changed to project lead in the project UI on [JRA-7925|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-7925]

h3. Expected Results
Workflow post function would reflect assign to project lead. 
h3. Actual Results
It says lead developer instead of project lead.
!confusion.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Regression: "Lead Developer" should be "Project Lead"

fields.description:
* A user do have permission to schedule
* B not

1. Both should open the same ticket, and start editing.
2. A should change sprint and some other data
3. B user should change story points
4. A user saves changes
5. B user saves changes

Result: changes done by B user overwrite changes done by A user, also the sprint will be changed back although B doesn't have permission to do it.

Expected result: validation prior saving, error message, form stays open.
fields.summary: Permission can be overridden while paralell editing

Mahesh Dubey
fields.summary: Global Variables for entire workflow

fields.description:
h5. Summary

When trying to clone a subtask by cloning its parent issue fails at some validation step, then a cloned issue gets created but without any subtask. In addition to it, there is no message shown up to notify user about that failure at all.

There are two possible solutions for this bug as you can see in *Expected Results* section as below. The purpose of reporting this bug are to keep tracking in bug list and wait for feedback from [~ohernandez@atlassian.com] to decide which way to go.

h5. Steps to reproduce

# Create a validator such as Required Fields (**Affects Version/s** for instance) by using JIRA Test Suites
# Create an issue and then a subtask for that newly created issue.
# Edit the subtask to remove **Affects Version/s**.
# Try to clone above issue with checking *Clone subtasks*.

h5. Expected Results

The issue as well as its subtasks do not create a clone at all and notifies user the reason.

h5. Actual Results

The issue gets cloned without any subtask as well as notification.

h5. Solution
We first check whether the issue including its *all* subtasks are able to be cloned, if not, we cancel the clone operation and explain user the problem.
*Involved classes*: {{CloneIssueDetails.java}}, {{CreateIssue.java}}, and {{CreateIssueDetails.java}}
fields.summary: When clone operation on subtask by parent issue fails at create transition, there is no reaction to user

fields.description:
For the month march the date picker (and edit window) generates 01/Mrz/15, but the validation wants to see 1/Mär/15. Because of that a date in March must be entered manually.

I think the issue is the same as in JRA-6253, just for German localization.

As far as I know, 3 letter abbreviations are not standardized in Germany. Both variants would be fine. Anyway, this date format is not common in Germany. Maybe a default format as defined in ISO 8601would be better..
fields.summary: Date picker / Validation mismatch in German localization

fields.description:
This is what I'm getting in the entries ("author" element) when I GET https://jira.salsitasoft.com/activity?maxResults=1000

<author xmlns:usr="http://streams.atlassian.com/syndication/username/1.0">
  <name></name>
  <link xmlns:media="http://purl.org/syndication/atommedia" rel="photo" href="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/596749?v=3&s=16" media:height="16" media:width="16" />
  <link xmlns:media="http://purl.org/syndication/atommedia" rel="photo" href="https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/596749?v=3&s=48" media:height="48" media:width="48" />
  <usr:username></usr:username>
  <activity:object-type>http://activitystrea.ms/schema/1.0/person</activity:object-type>
</author>

See the empty elements?

It works when I request it with "max-results=100".
fields.summary: JIRA activity feed malformed when requesting with "max-results=1000"

fields.description: In my add-on, I use, by injection, the OfBizCustomFieldValuePersister to store my customfield values.  This instance crashes when I use the getIssueIdsWithValue method and pass it the type PersistenceFieldType.TYPE_UNLIMITED_TEXT. The exception thrown by "findBy" mentions that "textvalue" is an invalid field for the table CustomFieldValue.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41083].
  {panel}

The documentation for delegated LDAP and nested groups does not indicate that there isn't any current support for nested groups and delegated LDAP.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+Internal+Directory+with+LDAP+Authentication

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Nested+Groups#ManagingNestedGroups-EffectofNestedGroups

Neither one of these documents reflects a current JAC ticket that indicates a lack of support for nested groups and delegated LDAP:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-25709
fields.summary: Update documentation to reflect lack of support for delegated LDAP and nested groups

fields.description:
using the Delegated LDAP Authentication. change the user password (used to login to the LDAP server) to contain an ! , save the new setting.

go to the database and look at ldap.password row in table cwd_directory_attribute notice the ! has been stripped from the password.

This is using SQL server 2012 as the external DB, with the application hosted on windows server 2008 R2.
fields.summary: Ldap.password strips !
Option to disable the refresh message in the Wallboard View

fields.description:
h3. Actual Results:

When using the "View as Wallboard" function of the Wallboard plugin, if we have any changes in the board used by the _Agile Wallboard Gadget_, a link appears in the bottom to refresh the gadget. However, the message is unreadable and is also using colors which are not ok with the rest of the screen.

Here is how the message appears in the dashboard:
!dashboard.png|thumbnail!

And here is how it appears using the _Wallboard View:
!wallboard.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Create a new dashboard;
# Insert a gadget that will trigger a refresh warn (such as the Agile Sprint);
# Make a change in the sprint that will trigger the refresh warn.

h3. Expected Results:

The text should be readable.

h3. Workaround:

No available workarounds.
fields.summary: Unreadable message in the Wallboard Plugin

fields.description:
When performing Project import from *Cloud* instance, for some reasons the custom fields are imported but the values are not picked up by the importer.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Generate an xml backup from the Cloud instance and deploy in a temporary Server instance
# Verify the field, screen, workflow configurations match between source and target instances.
# Run a Project import and import the project from the backup.
# Notice that the custom fields have no value after the project import.

h4.Affected Custom Fields
* Select List
* Radio Button

h4.Workaround

Restore the custom field values using [CSV import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+CSV].
fields.summary: Project Import from Cloud instance ignores the custom field values

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create an issue with  _Criticality_ of *Critical*
!email_1.jpg|thumbnail!
# Transition the ticket from Open to In Progress
!email_2.jpg|thumbnail!
# Update the _Criticality_ custom field from *Critical* to *Medium*
!email_3.jpg|thumbnail!
# Transition the ticket from in Progress to Open
!email_4.jpg|thumbnail!

If you would notice, the Criticality custom field has only been updated during Step 3, but the value for Criticality field has already been updated when the issue has been transitioned from Open to In Progress (step 2). 

Expected Behavior:
The email should have the Criticality of _Critical_ on the second email notification.

Actual Behavior:
* Email received from step 2 has an incorrect field value for Criticality. It is supposed to be Critical and not Medium because field update has only been done during step 3. 

Additional Information:
* Only reproducible when doing steps 2-4 in less than 10 seconds time
* Reproducible in JIRA 6.0.6 and 6.3.11
fields.summary: JIRA is sending incorrect email field values
Allow for editing of the information within the 'Scheduler Details'

fields.description: Somehow Crowd, Confluence, LDAP, etc does allow uppercasing in usernames and JIRA does not. When migrating from Cloud to Server in Confluence you can still login, in JIRA you cannot.
fields.summary: Uppercase usernames cannot login when migrating from Cloud to Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41059].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a JIRA project and a linked Bamboo plan
# Create a version in JIRA and release it with a new Bamboo build
# Delete that Bamboo build
# Try to release the same version again

h3. Current behaviour

JIRA displays the error as in:

!https://s3.amazonaws.com/uploads.hipchat.com/10804/166347/KBtKTZIOhFDzg9k/Capture.PNG | height=200px!

h3. Expected behaviour

Display a message clearly stating that the previous release has been deleted, as the current message can lead to believe that there are errors in the application link, such as JIRA not being able to reach Bamboo.
fields.summary: Trying to release a version again after deleting the original build will show "Bamboo unreachable error"

fields.description:
Usually we're using this way for ctearion new ticket:
- Click on Create button
- Put some text into new ticket fields
- Click on *preview* icon 
- If always seems ok - click on *preview* icon again for return from preview into normal mode
- Click on create button on the bottom of new ticket creation windows

Several stange situation:
- Make some searching into ticket via put the data into *search* field and get the some results of searching
- - Click on Create button
- Put some text into new ticket fields
- Click on *preview* icon 
- If always seems ok - click on *preview* icon again for return from preview into normal mode
wow! New ticket creation window selfdestructed :( and we're lost any text which we're already input into that window

How fix it?
fields.summary: Lost ticket creation windows after using search in tickets
The operator '!~' is not supported by the 'text' field.
Wrong updateAuthor on worklogs when logging for others.

fields.description:
We setup the workflow automation for Jira and git, for example if a branch will be created using "Create Branch" in Jira the issue status will be automatically change to "In progress". In this scenario we setup a post function "Assign to current user" but this doesn't work and the issue is still unassigned. I also checked that the user under test has the required "Assignable user" permission. Furthermore, I tried to use the post function "Assign to report" which worked but this is not really what we want.

Is this a bug in the current implementation of the workflow automation or is this post-function currently not supported?

Our projects are setup on the on demand instance of Jira.

Best regards
Sven
fields.summary: Current user will not set using the corresponding workflow post-function
why don't save condition & postfunction in jwb file exported from my workflow

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
(i) This is only reproducible in the "Export (current fields)" mode.
# Log in the system
# Go to Issue Navigator
# Modify the user's default columns (e.g. remove some colums)
# Write some query
# Save this query as a filter
# Customize the filter's columns (e.g. add some fields)
# Ensure that new columns are saved as the filter's parameters and the Issue Navigator displays columns accordingly to the filter's settings
# Try to export as the Excel sheet. All column are correct at this moment
# Modify the query (e.g. by adding one more search criterion), but do not save the filter. Issue Navigator display columns accordingly to filter's settings at this moment.
# Try to export as the Excel sheet.

h3. Current behaviour

The exported columns will be as per your user's settings, instead of the filter's settings.

h3. Expected behaviour

Keep exporting the field configuration instead of user's.
fields.summary: Modifying a saved filter won't export filter fields but user fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41046].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 11 December 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

We expect a fix for this issue to be released in early January for both JIRA Cloud and JIRA Server.

We will update the current behavior to remove the association between Issue Worklogs and the Issue Updated event. This should resolve the problem originally described in this issue.

As I mentioned in my previous update, improving events and email notifications is part of the current JIRA roadmap. A number of you have indicated that there are existing challenges you face with JIRA email notifications beyond this issue. We would love to hear your feedback and suggestions – feel free to contact me directly.

Thanks,
Dave
Product Manager - JIRA Platform
{panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Remove all log work notification
!1.png|thumbnail!
#* This is verified by the Notification Helper
!2.png|thumbnail!
# Have the user create an issue (PROA-4 in my test)
# As an admin, log work on the issue

h4. Expected Results
* No email notification received by reporter

h4. Actual Results
* Email is sent to reporter
!3.png|thumbnail!

h4. Additional
* When no notification is configured to send for work logged, email says *Admin updated an issue*
* When work logged is configured to send notification, email says *Admin added a worklog*
!4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Logging work sends email even if not configured in notification scheme
500 error page is inappropriate for corporate environment

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Create a new Project.
# Set the Proect permission to only visible for jira-developers.
# Create an issue.
# Create a new users which will be assigned to jira-users group only.
# Login using the new user.
# Try to access the newly created issue before, for example by pasting the URL below:
{code}<JIRA Base URL>/browse/<issue key>
http://localhost:8639/browse/TEST-1{code}
# Alternatively, by accessing the link below will do:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/JRA-44

*Expected Behaviour*:
There will be a Permission Violation Warning appearing in the page letting the user knows for nor having the necessary information.

*Actual Result*:
Somehow the page is being redirected to a blank Issue Navigator page without the warning appearing.
fields.summary: IE9 Doesn't Show Permission Violation Warning

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41043].
  {panel}

When two issues are linked together in JIRA by one user, but the linked issue is not visible for a second user, then the issuekey of the linked issue still will be leaked to that second user, using the History Tab.

Steps to reproduce:
- User A creates Issue 1. This issue is visible to User A and User B.
- User A creates Issue 2. This issue is visible to User A and User C.
- User A (who has rights on both issues), links issue 1 to issue 2.
- Note that User B does not have any rights on the issue or project in witch issue 2 is created.
- User C opens issue 2
-- In the main view of the issue, no reference to Issue 1 is shown (this is correct)
-- When the user clicks the History tab, there is a reference to Issue 2 (this is incorrect, and should not be visible)
fields.summary: Linked Issues displayed in History tab, regardless of permissons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41041].
  {panel}

h2. Symptom

CPU Usage high and potentially running into outofmemory error.

When generating thread dump, below stack is found:

{noformat}
"TP-Processor2" daemon prio=10 tid=0x4b897000 nid=0x46a3 runnable [0x4d48b000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.util.ResourceBundle.getClassContext(Native Method)
	at java.util.ResourceBundle.getLoader(ResourceBundle.java:400)
	at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle(ResourceBundle.java:822)
	at sun.util.resources.LocaleData$1.run(LocaleData.java:127)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at sun.util.resources.LocaleData.getBundle(LocaleData.java:125)
	at sun.util.resources.LocaleData.getDateFormatData(LocaleData.java:113)
	at java.text.DateFormatSymbols.cacheLookup(DateFormatSymbols.java:578)
	at java.text.DateFormatSymbols.initializeData(DateFormatSymbols.java:587)
	at java.text.DateFormatSymbols. (DateFormatSymbols.java:123)
	at java.text.DateFormatSymbols.getInstance(DateFormatSymbols.java:297)
	at java.text.SimpleDateFormat. (SimpleDateFormat.java:499)
	at java.text.SimpleDateFormat. (SimpleDateFormat.java:476)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.Iso8601. (Iso8601.java:63)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.Time. (Time.java:74)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.DateTime. (DateTime.java:110)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar.model.DateFieldProvider.getDate(DateFieldProvider.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar.model.IssueComparator.compare(IssueComparator.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar.model.IssueComparator.compare(IssueComparator.java:9)
{noformat}

Scanning the access logs which being served more than 60 seconds, potentially showing the call for the Calender:

{noformat}
awk '{ if ($11 > 60000000) print $0; }' /path/to/access_log

131.103.26.162 111.93.251.138 - [23/Nov/2014:07:10:54 +0530] "GET /rest/calendar-plugin/1.0/calendar/htmlcalendar.html?dateFieldName=customfield_10201&displayVersions=false&numOfIssueIcons=10&context=gadget&portletId=10286&includeContainer=true&searchRequestId=10157&_=1416706853400 HTTP/1.0" 200 49104 104464109 "<instance name>/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlassian&mid=10286&country=US&lang=en&view=default&view-params=%7B%22writable%22%3A%22false%22%7D&st=atlassian%3AYasv4X6Y%2BcC2C2r2ihAQukEYqqp6x8QJ65Rk5GQUxM6pDjgF8FjgQVgGehSkmSzGieCE19cHKm%2FLsanNHGOy2BV7LrS2JJ%2BcRyC%2FUrOOI%2BvzG1K9OeLZb0Hcc5ejYeQSCMN7qVYKzu0R6qZelv0nP%2F5ruFAxc3J9lXaSuFcI1WsujoWYgBIVE2HzOkQWm0fIEBpjuTjFcmWvp%2B8Uos0S%2F%2FtNjyWAh1BXTJB6D3Y9KqJKBkJLKXgHO0gB6FZBSkK4k635F%2FUKLx0s5VrJfh8Hl3gdG1Cqcx6MwzlGO4O%2F1Km4zgU5%2B28nUBimuLPdlJdEGPxSLwztoDzuR5351pjqPUsvT1Sog8Z7m7%2BdTXgom5CYCJM2donoowZH9r3n7z4ycc5iQbtWM1FLVWtyiP0rcsYWWA0Q3HEMoeyNO094H7o1U%2BaFgNPfT8eckCqToBrHHulqSw%3D%3D&up_isConfigured=true&up_projectOrFilterId=filter-10157&up_dateFieldName=customfield_10201&up_displayVersions=false&up_numOfIssueIcons=10&up_refresh=15&url=https%3A%2F%2F<instance name>t%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar%3Aissuescalendar-gadget%2Ftemplates%2Fplugins%2Fjira%2Fportlets%2Fcalendar%2Fgadget%2Fcalendar-gadget.xml&libs=auth-refresh" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.2; WOW64; rv:19.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/19.0"
{noformat}

h2. Cause: 

The Calender Gadget retrieving all the issues and attempts to compare the date to render the result. 

Tested using a vanilla instance, generated 30k issues with 30k custom field (date time) and added a Calender to show. It spikes the CPU usage and took more than 5 seconds to complete rendering the data. Imagine the impact for a busy instances, a bad combination could result on constant GC and CPU consistently high.

h2. Workaround

To down size the filter by adding the created date clause to reduce the number returned. Or remove the gadget to check if this is the primary cause of the issue.
fields.summary: The Calendar Gadget can cause high CPU and memory usage for large filters
Ability to search for issues that were moved.

This used to be a feature in JIRA 6.0 (and maybe 6.1), but it no longer shows the spinner today.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41033].
  {panel}

Images taken with rotated cameras, iPhones etc. are displayed without compensation for that rotation. This means users have to rotate the image and save it in another program before attach it Jira in order to have the image displayed as expected. Images contain EXIF information that will allow Jira to do this rotation for the users automatically.

When you view the image in issue view, the image will be up side down.
However when you view the image at the image directory for example : https://stan.jira-dev.com/secure/attachment/10001/IMG_7275.JPG

The browser will show the image in the correct orientation.
fields.summary: Support EXIF orientation so that images are displayed with the expected orientation
Allow to specify multiple users in the Time Sheet gadget

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm blind and am using Jaws version 15 both with IE 11 and Firefox latest version.

When completing issues in jira fileds which have the label:

Start typing to get a list of possible matches or press down to select.

It is impossible to access the list of items with the screen reader.

If I start typing and then leave the edit field, there is no sign of any list on screen.

If only one match exists  then pressing the tab key will fill out the field, but this is no good where multiple items are present in the list.

Sighted colleagues have confirmed that a list is visible to them.

I note that an accessibility issue has  been raised with source tree for windows, see:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-520

No details are actually given as to what  is the shortcoming in  the description for this issue, so I can't say if it is related to my problem.

As a blind developer, this issue has a serious impact on my ability to independently fill out and complete issues in Jira.

Is there anypossibility this issue could be resolved shortly?

Tim
fields.summary: List generated by fields labelled "Start typing to get a list of possible matches or press down to select." are not accessible with a screen reader

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41021].
  {panel}

# Edit a Workflow.
# Go to Diagram mode.
# Select a Status to edit.
# A popup box appears giving editing options for the Status.
# There should be a checkbox for the option "Allow all statuses to transition to this one" - Select it.
# A transition is now created in every Status for that Status type. This includes itself.

!image.png|thumbnail!

Once the "Allow all statuses..." has been set, you cannot delete the single transition to self while keeping the remaining useful transitions. Additionally since this setting is redundant, it also takes up space in the button bar which could be better used for other more relevant buttons.
fields.summary: Allow all statuses to transition to this one option allows transition to self
Filter Subscription Send Based on JQL

fields.description:
If an admin moves an existing user from one Crowd directory to another, a manual sync only imports the user on that initial synch.  That user's groups do no come over.  Subsequent Automatic synchs will bring one group at a time over from Crowd, but all of the groups listed will still never come over - most notably jira-users never seems to synch over.

*Method of moving user*
The user has an existing account in Crowd Directory A.  This user is deleted from Crowd Directory A and is re-created in Crowd Directory B.  The user account has the same samaccountname, email address, and groups

*Crowd Directory Information*
Both directories are Crowd delegated authentication connected to AD directories.

*Workaround*
It has been discovered that if a user has an issue assigned to them while they are in Crowd Directory A, their groups will synch over in full when they are deleted from Directory A and re-created in Crowd Directory B.  Users who never have an issue assigned to them suffer from the unexpected behavior.  A workaround for this issue has been put in place where dummy issues are created for those users in Directory A who have never had an issue assigned to them prior to being deleted and re-created in Directory B.
fields.summary: User's groups do not synch as expected when moved from one Crowd directory to another.
JIRA Evaluation license should show the number of Active Users

fields.description:
h3. Symptom
Workflow step which contain property to restrict comment is blocking transition with comment before status changed.
Mentioned property {{jira.permission.comment.user}} value {{denied}}/{{false}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with a workflow having property as above in *Closed* step
# Create an issue
# Transition the issue until *Close Issue* transition's screen
# Add a comment and proceed with transitioning the issue, JIRA will throw error saying current user doesn't have the permission to comment

h3. Expected behavior
Adding comment should be possible as the issue status is not yet transitioned into restricted status for commenting. This expected behavior is also tied to this bug - JRA-40629
fields.summary: Workflow step which contain property to restrict comment is blocking transition with comment before status changed

fields.description:
I accidentally lost 5 minutes of work because the issue create dialog failed me.

If you type out and issue, then change the issue type, then press ESC, no dirty form warning is shown. Why would you press "ESC" you may ask? Accidents happen…

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Click the blue "Create" button in the application header to open the create issue dialog.
# Type some content into the 'Summary' field.
# Press ESC, note that you are warned that you will lose content.
# Back out of the warning (press cancel).
# Now change the Issue Type to something else.
# Press ESC, note that you receive no warning.

The rationale for the Major severity here is that this bug leads to data loss, which is completely unacceptable.

*Environment:*

- Chrome 38.0.2125.122
- Safari 8.0 (10600.1.25)
fields.summary: Issue create dialog doesn't pop a dirty form warning after changing issue type
Restricted by domain(s) option for JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41007].
  {panel}

If I run a search from the input box on:
https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa

And it has spaces in the search temr, e.g. "some bug card", the URL it directs my browser to is:
https://www.atlassian.com/search.action?query=some+bug+card

Which then shows the "+" signs in the search box.  If I replace the "+"s with spaces and hit search on this page, I now get directed to:
https://www.atlassian.com/search.action?query=some%20bug%20card

Which appears to work correctly.

I suspect the dashboard is using incorrect character escaping when building the URL to redirect to.
fields.summary: jira dashboard does not escape spaces properly for atlassian search page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41006].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour

JIRA/Confluence some times need to scale the original size of the global logo. The resultant size may differ by using oversized or undersized images. To reproduce, just upload a custom logo to both JIRA and Confluence via global logo admin section respectively.

See the inconsistencies between JIRA and Confluence using the [attached logo|^Atlassian-ondemand-logo.png]. 

JIRA: 
!JIRA.png!

Confluence:
!Confluence.png!

It could be well related to the constraint set by both apps. These info messages are displayed on the global logo upload page:

* JIRA: "The height of the logo image will be constrained to a maximum of 30 px. Also, it is recommended to use an image with a 57 px width."
* Confluence: "The height of the logo image will be constrained to a maximum of 48 px."

This is verified on Chrome, Safari, Firefox.

h3. Feature Request

Ensure consistency of the global logo size across all apps. This is important for branding.
fields.summary: Consistent global logo size across JIRA and Confluence

fields.description:
Basically, is the same as https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-31774

When JQL consist of more than 6000 characters in *Google Chrome* or *Mozilla Firefox*, it will show the following error:
{panel}
Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again.
{panel}

On *Internet Explorer* and *Microsoft Edge*, it does not show any error message from the user interface. However, if you pull up the _F12 Developer Tools_, you will find it returns error message "{{jqlTooComplex}}" under the response body.

h4. Work Around

Break down the main JQL filter into smaller chunks of JQL filters e.g. filter in ("Filter 1", "Filter 2").
fields.summary: JQL limitation (6000 character limitation)
